alternative_parents.description: Amide derivatives of alpha amino acids.
alternative_parents.name: Alpha amino acid amides

alternative_parents.description: Glycoside in which a sugar group is bonded through one carbon to another group via a S-glycosidic bond.
alternative_parents.name: Thioglycosides

alternative_parents.description: Pyrrolidines in which the pyrrolidine rings is substituted at one or more positions by a carboxamide group. Pyrrolidine is a five-membered saturated aliphatic heterocycle with one nitrogen atom and four carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Pyrrolidinecarboxamides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an oxane (tetrahydropyran) ring, which is a six-member saturated aliphatic heterocycle with one oxygen atom and five carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Oxanes

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a pyrrolidine moiety that is substituted at the N1-position with an alkyl group. Pyrrolidine is a five-membered saturated aliphatic heterocycle with one nitrogen atom and four carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: N-alkylpyrrolidines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing one carbohydrate unit not glycosidically linked to another such unit, and no set of two or more glycosidically linked carbohydrate units. Monosaccharides have the general formula CnH2nOn.
alternative_parents.name: Monosaccharides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a monothioacetal functional group with the general structure R2C(OR')(SR').
alternative_parents.name: Monothioacetals

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a trialkylamine group, characterized by exactly three alkyl groups bonded to the amino nitrogen.
alternative_parents.name: Trialkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary carboxylic acid amide functional group, with the general structure RC(=O)N(R')H (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary carboxylic acid amides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary alcohol functional group, with the general structure HOC(R)(R') (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organosulfur compounds a sulfenyl group with the general formula RS (R = organyl).
alternative_parents.name: Sulfenyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing more than one hydroxyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Polyols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one oxygen atom linked to a ring carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Oxacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic salts that results from the reaction of hydrochloric acid with an organic base.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrochlorides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

class.description: Compounds containing a carboxylic acid group with the formula -C(=O)OH or a derivative thereof.
class.name: Carboxylic acids and derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as proline and derivatives. These are compounds containing proline or a derivative thereof resulting from reaction of proline at the amino group or the carboxy group, or from the replacement of any hydrogen of glycine by a heteroatom.

direct_parent.description: Compounds containing proline or a derivative thereof resulting from reaction of proline at the amino group or the carboxy group, or from the replacement of any hydrogen of glycine by a heteroatom.
direct_parent.name: Proline and derivatives

intermediate_nodes.description: Organic compounds containing an amine group, a carboxylic acid group (or a derivative thereof), and a side-chain that is specific to each amino acid.
intermediate_nodes.name: Amino acids and derivatives

intermediate_nodes.description: Amino acids in which the amino group is attached to the carbon atom immediately adjacent to the carboxylate group (alpha carbon), or a derivative thereof.
intermediate_nodes.name: Alpha amino acids and derivatives

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Organic compounds containing an amino acid or a peptide backbone, or derivatives thereof.
subclass.name: Amino acids, peptides, and analogues

superclass.description: Compounds an organic acid or a derivative thereof.
superclass.name: Organic acids and derivatives
